programme.title: Top Players
programme.desc: What are the most incredible and amazing stories behind the Top Football Players ?

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Salah
programme.desc: Exploring the importance of prayer within Islam, the episode begins with an overview of our seven athletes as they introduce themselves and why Islam is so important to them. We are also introduced to Omar Sulieman, a notable Imam, who acts as narration throughout the series and a guiding voice on the key principles of Islam.The life and career of Sofyan Amrabat is explored, showcasing his role as a key part of the Fenerbahce team in Turkey and the Moroccan national side. The Atlas Lions’ run to the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is explored, with the impact that Salah played in the team’s belief and positivity throughout the tournament.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Ummah
programme.desc: Ummah is an Arabic word meaning

programme.title: My Faith in Sport -Sawm
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab.Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan

programme.title: My Faith in Sport -Takkafur
programme.desc: Islam teaches Muslims about ‘Tawakkul’ meaning trusting in God’s plan. Muslims believe in the idea that with anything in life we put forward our best efforts but ultimately the rest is left to God and believing whatever the outcome, it was pre-written. Omar Marmoush is the feature athlete in the final episode of the series – from the outskirts of the Eintracht Frankfurt side to an $80m move to Premier League Manchester City, his last 18 months has seen an incredible rise. His love of Ramadan and belief that fasting elevates his game is a central theme of the final episode alongside detail of his early life, career and his unfaltering belief in Islam. programme.desc: This will be the first season whereby the UEFA Europa League will be played under a new format, which replaces the 32-team group stage with a 36-team league phase. The new format also does not allow teams to transfer from the Champions League knockout stage to the Europa League knockout stage. The final will be played on 21 May 2025 at San Mames stadium in Bilbao, Spain.All matches are live and exclusive only on beIN.

programme.title: Bundesliga - Special 2024/2025 - Roots: Kane, Schick and Ekitike
programme.desc: Three strikers, three stories, one common goal: scoring goals for the teams success. But what shaped Harry Kane, Patrik Schick, and Hugo Ekitike on their paths to the top? programme.title: Morocco vs South Africa - CAF U17 Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025 - Quarter Finals
programme.desc: The 2025 U-17 Africa Cup of Nations is the 15th edition of the biennial African youth football tournament organized by Confederation of African Football (CAF) for players aged 17 and below. Morocco was chosen as the host of this edition The top 10 teams will qualify for the 2025 FIFA U-17 World Cup in Qatar as the CAF representatives. It is the first U-17 Africa Cup of Nations to feature 16 teams. Senegal are the defending champions.

programme.title: Lorenzo MUSETTI (ITA) vs Stefanos TSITSIPAS (GRE) - Q4 - Rolex Monte Carlo Masters - ATP 1000 - Mona
programme.desc: The Rolex Monte-Carlo Masters is a prestigious ATP Masters 1000 clay-court tournament held annually at the Monte Carlo Country Club in Roquebrune-Cap-Martin, France, near Monaco. Celebrating its 118th edition in 2025. As the first of three clay-court Masters 1000 tournaments each season, it attracts the worlds top tennis talent, offering valuable points and prize money. The tournament has seen legendary champions, with Rafael Nadal holding a record 11 titles.

programme.title: A. Kovacevic (USA) vs F. Auger Aliassime (CAN) - Final - Occitanie Open - ATP 250 - Montpellier 202
programme.desc: The 2025 Open Sud de France final in Montpellier sees qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic (USA) take on second seed Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN). Kovacevic, making a stunning run from the qualifiers, aims for his maiden ATP title, while Auger-Aliassime, a former finalist in Montpellier, looks to secure his first trophy of the season. With Kovacevics resilience and Auger-Aliassime’s firepower, the final promises an intense battle for the championship.

programme.title: Aryna Sabalenka vs Madison Keys (USA) - Womens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian Open
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka faces Madison Keys in the Australian Open women’s singles final. Sabalenka, the World No. 1, dominates their head-to-head 4-1 and looks unstoppable on Rod Laver Arena, riding a 20-match winning streak. Keys, ranked 19th, delivers a stunning run, defeating top seeds, including Iga Swiatek, with improved form under her husband-coach Bjorn Fratangelo. A clash of power and precision unfolds as they battle for the title.

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Alexander Zverev (GER) -Mens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian O
programme.desc: The 2025 Australian Open men’s singles final sees defending champion and World No. 1 Jannik Sinner taking on World No. 2 Alexander Zverev. Sinner chases his third Grand Slam title after dominating Ben Shelton in the semifinals. Zverev, still in search of his first Grand Slam title, advanced after Novak Djokovic retired due to injury. A thrilling battle unfolds, with Sinner’s aggressive play clashing against Zverev’s powerful serves and groundstrokes.

programme.title: Practice 1 - F1 Gulf Air Bahrain Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: Held on April 11 at the Bahrain International Circuit, the first practice session gave teams a crucial hour to fine-tune setups in hot desert conditions. Early pace-setters included top contenders like Lando Norris and Max Verstappen, as teams focused on tire data and race simulations ahead of qualifying.

programme.title: Qualifying - FIA Formula 3 Championship - Bahrain Round
programme.desc: The 2025 FIA Formula 3 Championship is an open-wheel racing category serving as the third tier of formula racing in the FIA Global Pathway. The category will be run in support of selected rounds of the 2025 FIA Formula One World Championship. As the championship is a spec series, all teams and drivers competing in the championship will run the same car, the Dallara F3 2025. Prema Racing are the reigning Teams Champions

programme.title: Qualifying - FIA Formula 2 Championship - Bahrain Round
programme.desc: The 2025 FIA Formula 2 Championship is an open-wheel racing category serving as the second tier of formula racing in the FIA Global Pathway. The category will be run in support of selected rounds of the 2025 Formula One World Championship. As the championship is a spec series, all teams and drivers competing in the championship will run the same car, the new Dallara F2 2024. Invicta Racing are the reigning Teams Champions.

programme.title: Practice 2 - F1 Gulf Air Bahrain Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: In this key evening session, teams shift focus to race simulations under cooler track conditions. Drivers aim to fine-tune balance and tire strategies, with particular emphasis on long-run pace. The session is expected to provide the clearest insight yet into the pecking order ahead of qualifying.

programme.desc: The MotoGP Qatar Grand Prix qualifying session at the Lusail International Circuit determines the starting grid for both the Sprint and main races. Riders compete in two 15-minute sessions—Qualifying 1 (Q1) and Qualifying 2 (Q2). The fastest 10 from practice sessions advance directly to Q2, while the rest compete in Q1, with the top two from Q1 joining Q2. This format ensures a competitive lineup for the races on the 5.4 km illuminated track.

programme.title: Moto 3 Qualifying - Qatar GP - Moto GP

The fastest riders from Q1 advance to Q2, where they battle for pole position on the 5.4 km track known for its mix of long straights and technical corners.

programme.title: GP Confidential 2025 Magazine
programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Across 25 episodes and in crisp 3D animations, we analyses the technical details, which decide which teams make the most of the rules - and which need to go back to the drawing board. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: Sprint Race - Qatar GP - Moto GP
programme.desc: The 2025 MotoGP Qatar Grand Prix Sprint Race at Lusail International Circuit is a short-format race covering half the distance of the main event. Riders compete for championship points, with the top nine finishers earning points on a sliding scale: 12 points for first place, 9 for second, 7 for third, and so on down to 1 point for ninth place. This sprint offers an additional challenge and opportunity for riders to gain crucial points ahead of the main race.

programme.title: EPL The Big Interview 2024/25 - Robert Pires
programme.desc: This week on The Big Interview, two-time Premier League champion, Robert Pires sits down to talk through his career and all things Arsenal. Having joined the club during Arsene Wengers reign, Pires played in one of the greatest sides in the clubs history - as well as helping them achieve Invincible status In 2003/04. The French winger recalls almost quitting football at a young age and how his mother persuaded him to change his mind, winning the World Cup with France, the difficulties he faced when he first joined the Gunners and what this current Arsenal side need to do to win the Premier League title once again

On 21st March 2025, the top sim racers will then start with the first race event at the virtual Circuit Zandvoort. A total of twelve races in six rounds are to be completed on the DTM circuits before the grand finale takes place on 18th July 2025. Even if you dont qualify, you can still race on the championship tracks with the DTM 2024 Car Pack.

programme.title: Race 1 - World Super Bike - Dutch Round
programme.desc: The Superbike World Championship roars into Portugal for another adrenaline-fueled showdown at the Autodromo Internacional do Algarve. Watch as the world’s top riders battle for supremacy on high-speed straights and technical corners, pushing their machines to the limit. Expect fierce rivalries, last-lap duels, and heart-stopping action in this thrilling Race 2 clash.

programme.title: Borussia Monchengladbach vs Freiburg - Bundesliga 2024/25 Week 29
programme.desc: The German Bundesliga is live and exclusive only on beIN. The 2024–25 Bundesliga will be the 62nd season of the Bundesliga. The league comprises of 18 teams 16 of which competed in the league campaign during the previous season, while the remaining two were promoted from Bundesliga 2.

programme.title: Coppa Shell Race 1 - Ferrari Challenge - Misano Round
programme.desc: The 2025 Ferrari Challenge Europe continues with Coppa Shell Race 1 at Italys Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli. Drivers will compete on the 4.226 km track, known for its technical turns and fast straights, as part of the second round of the season. features 16 corners that challenge drivers with a mix of technical turns and fast straights. The Misano round marks the second event in the eight-round series, following the season opener at Monza.

programme.title: Poitiers vs Tourcoing - Marmara Spike ligue Volleyball 2024
programme.desc: The LNV Ligue A Masculine (LAM), currently known as the Marmara SpikeLigue for sponsorship reasons, is the top-tier mens volleyball league in France, established in 1938. Governed by the Ligue Nationale de Volley (LNV) under the French Volleyball Federation (FFVB), the league features Frances elite volleyball talent. Formerly called Pro A until 2009, it shares a rich history and prestige akin to its basketball counterpart.

programme.title: Limoges vs Nantes - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.
